queryParameters.name: query
queryParameters.description: Filter the results using a literal string. Projects with a matching key or name are returned (case insensitive).

queryParameters.name: orderBy
queryParameters.description: Order the results by a field.

queryParameters.name: typeKey
queryParameters.description: Orders results by the project type. This parameter accepts a comma-separated list. Valid values are business, service_desk, and software.

queryParameters.name: categoryId
queryParameters.description: The ID of the project's category. A complete list of category IDs is found using the Get all project categories operation.

queryParameters.name: searchBy
queryParameters.description: Default: key, name

queryParameters.name: action
queryParameters.description: Filter results by projects for which the user can: view, browse, and edit. Default: view

queryParameters.name: expand
queryParameters.description: the parameters to expand. This parameter accepts a comma-separated list.

queryParameters.name: recent
queryParameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID

queryParameters.name: issueId
queryParameters.description: Id of the issue to scope returned permissions for.

queryParameters.name: issueKey
queryParameters.description: Key of the issue to scope returned permissions for.

queryParameters.name: projectId
queryParameters.description: Id of project to scope returned permissions for.

queryParameters.name: projectKey
queryParameters.description: Key of project to scope returned permissions for.

Get remote version links by version id

queryParameters.name: Workflow Name
queryParameters.description: The name of a workflow to return.

queryParameters.name: expand
queryParameters.description: Use expand to include additional information in the response. This parameter accepts a comma-separated list.

queryParameters.name: Key
queryParameters.description: The key of the property being returned, also known as the name of the property.

queryParameters.name: workflowMode
queryParameters.description: The workflow status.

queryParameters.name: workflowName
queryParameters.description: The name of the workflow that the transition belongs to.

queryParameters.name: accountId
queryParameters.description: The account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, 5b10ac8d82e05b22cc7d4ef5.

queryParameters.name: Query
queryParameters.description: A query string that is matched against user attributes ( displayName, and emailAddress) to find relevant users. The string can match the prefix of the attribute's value. For example, query=john matches a user with a displayName of John Smith and a user with an emailAddress of johnson@example.com.

queryParameters.name: Account Id
queryParameters.description: A query string that is matched exactly against a user accountId.

queryParameters.name: Property
queryParameters.description: A query string used to search properties. Property keys are specified by path, so property keys containing dot (.) or equals (=) characters cannot be used. The query string cannot be specified using a JSON object.

queryParameters.name: key
queryParameters.description: key of the preference to be returned.

queryParameters.name: filter
queryParameters.description: an optional filter that is applied to the list of dashboards.

queryParameters.name: expand
queryParameters.description: Use expand to include additional information in the response.

queryParameters.name: expand
queryParameters.description: Use expand to include additional information in the response.

queryParameters.name: filterName
queryParameters.description: String used to perform a case-insensitive partial match with name.

queryParameters.name: accountId
queryParameters.description: User account ID used to return filters with the matching owner.accountId. This parameter cannot be used with owner.

queryParameters.name: groupname
queryParameters.description: Group name used to returns filters that are shared with a group that matches sharePermissions.group.groupname.

queryParameters.name: projectId
queryParameters.description: Project ID used to returns filters that are shared with a project that matches sharePermissions.project.id.

queryParameters.name: orderBy
queryParameters.description: Order the results by a field

queryParameters.name: Expand
queryParameters.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response.

queryParameters.name: Expand
queryParameters.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response.

queryParameters.name: projectId
queryParameters.description: Filters the results to options that are only available in the specified project. For example, 10000.

queryParameters.name: projectId
queryParameters.description: Filters the results to options that are only available in the specified project. For example, 10000.

queryParameters.name: jql
queryParameters.description: a JQL query string

queryParameters.name: validateQuery
queryParameters.description: Determines how to validate the JQL query and treat the validation results.

queryParameters.name: fields
queryParameters.description: the list of fields to return for each issue. By default, all navigable fields are returned.

queryParameters.name: expand
queryParameters.description: A comma-separated list of the parameters to expand.

queryParameters.name: fields
queryParameters.description: the list of fields to return for the issue. By default, all fields are returned.

queryParameters.name: expand
queryParameters.description: the parameters to expand

queryParameters.name: updateHistory
queryParameters.description: If set to true, adds the issue retrieved by this method to the current users issue history.

queryParameters.name: properties
queryParameters.description: the list of properties to return for the issue. By default no properties are returned.

queryParameters.name: orderBy
queryParameters.description: ordering of the results.

queryParameters.name: expand
queryParameters.description: the parameters to expand

queryParameters.name: expand
queryParameters.description: the parameters to expand

queryParameters.name: overrideEditableFlag
queryParameters.description: Allows retrieving edit metadata for fields in non-editable status (jira.issue.editable flag set to false or missing).

queryParameters.name: overrideScreenSecurity
queryParameters.description: Allows retrieving edit metadata for the fields hidden on Edit screen.

queryParameters.name: global Id
queryParameters.description: The id of the remote issue link to be returned. If null (not provided) all remote links for the issue are returned. For a fullexplanation of Issue Link fields please refer to https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Fields+in+Remote+Issue+Links

endpoints.name: Get remote issue links By RemotelinkId

queryParameters.name: projectIds
queryParameters.description: combined with the projectKeys param, lists the projects with which to filter the results. If absent, all projects are returned. This parameter can be specified multiple times, and/or be a comma-separated list. Specifiying a project that does not exist (or that you cannot create issues in) is not an error, but it will not be in the results.

queryParameters.name: projectKeys
queryParameters.description: combined with the projectIds param, lists the projects with which to filter the results. If null, all projects are returned. This parameter can be specified multiple times, and/or be a comma-separated list. Specifiying a project that does not exist (or that you cannot create issues in) is not an error, but it will not be in the results.

queryParameters.name: issuetypeIds
queryParameters.description: combinded with issuetypeNames, lists the issue types with which to filter the results. If null, all issue types are returned. This parameter can be specified multiple times, and/or be a comma-separated list. Specifiying an issue type that does not exist is not an error.

queryParameters.name: issuetypeNames
queryParameters.description: combinded with issuetypeIds, lists the issue types with which to filter the results. If null, all issue types are returned. This parameter can be specified multiple times, but is NOT interpreted as a comma-separated list. Specifiying an issue type that does not exist is not an error.

queryParameters.name: query
queryParameters.description: the query.

queryParameters.name: currentJQL
queryParameters.description: the JQL in context of which the request is executed. Only issues which match this JQL query will be included in results.

queryParameters.name: currentIssueKey
queryParameters.description: the key of the issue in context of which the request is executed. The issue which is in context will not be included in the auto-completion result, even if it matches the query.

queryParameters.name: currentProjectId
queryParameters.description: the id of the project in context of which the request is executed. Suggested issues will be only from this project.

queryParameters.name: showSubTasks
queryParameters.description: if set to false, subtasks will not be included in the list.

queryParameters.name: showSubTaskParent
queryParameters.description: if set to false and request is executed in context of a subtask, the parent issue will not be included in the auto-completion result, even if it matches the query.
